name: Post-Traumatic Abdominal Compartment Syndrome with Concurrent Anastomotic Leak
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain and difficulty breathing after recent bowel surgery
treatment: temporary abdominal closure with negative pressure dressing
prognosis: Guarded - mortality approaches 60% when combined with anastomotic failure. Survivors often require multiple reoperations and prolonged ICU care.
description: A life-threatening condition where increased intra-abdominal pressure (>20mmHg) causes multi-organ dysfunction following trauma or major abdominal surgery, complicated by breakdown of a surgical bowel connection. This creates a perfect storm of mechanical compression, systemic inflammation, and peritoneal contamination.
multiple_choice: Post-Traumatic Abdominal Compartment Syndrome with Concurrent Anastomotic Leak
